D.

While "B. To ensure that the project outputs are agreed" is certainly a part of the quality theme, it's not the overarching purpose. The most accurate answer here is D. To enable the project to be managed according to plan.

Here's why:

Fitness for Purpose: The quality theme in PRINCE2 focuses on ensuring that products are "fit for purpose." This means they meet the criteria defined in the project plan and satisfy the needs of the users.   
Meeting Requirements: By defining and adhering to quality standards, the project can be managed effectively and deliver the expected outcomes. This includes:
Defining clear quality criteria for products.   
Implementing quality control procedures.   
Using quality assurance to independently review the project.   
Managing any quality deviations from the plan.

Why the other options are less accurate:

B. What will be used to record the effectiveness of the project's approaches: While recording is important, the focus is on the actions to achieve benefits, not just the recording method.
C. How the project has progressed against its plans: This is covered by the Progress theme, not the benefits management approach.
D. The suitability of the project management team structure: This is addressed by the Organization theme.   
Key takeaway: The benefits management approach is a crucial part of PRINCE2. It ensures that the project focuses on delivering value by defining the actions needed to achieve and sustain the intended benefit
